reviews.sentence: Love this hotel. I actually stayed here in July of 2014 and did not get around to review this place. My boyfriend and I absolutely love this hotel. The staff was friendly and had great customer service. The room was to die for. It had a beautiful vintage nautical theme. The room was clean and spacious. It had an amazing view of the bay. I love they had a table outside with two chairs out on your patio. It was relaxing to sit outside and enjoy the view. This hotel was worth every penny and we will definitely rebok again.

Perfect getaway. My partner and I planned a last minute getaway for our anniversary and the Waterfront Hotel was the right choice. The location was perfect easy drive to the Oracle Arena with beautiful views of the water. Upon our arrival we were offered a room upgrade to celebrate our anniversary and Ime was very helpful to let us know what the hotel had to offer which included a wine and cheese hour. There are plenty of restaurants in the area but we had limited time before the game so we chose to order room service. We had the Margarita pizza and the half chicken SO yummy. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Oakland.

First class all the way. We chose the Waterfront Plaza because we were going to be attending a class reunion and the location for the event was perfect. We arrived Friday 826 at 10PM and were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready. We were checked in by Ime who was very helpful even though she was the only one on the front desk and the phones were a bit hectic. Even with that she was polite cheerful and we were checked in quickly. Pablo met us in the lobby with our luggage. We gave him our room number and he said he would meet us there. The room we were assigned was very nice and quite large however it did not have a balcony. We were going to be staying 2 nights and thought a balcony would really make our stay that much more special. We called Ime and asked if there were any balcony rooms available. She said she would check and call us back. In the mean time Pablo arrived with our luggage. We told him what we were trying to do. No problem. While the 3 of us waited for Ime to call back we chatted and found out that Pablo is a very nice polite and professional young man who really seems as though he enjoys his job. I called down to Ime a second time. She was still busy but assured me she would check and call back. Pablos shift was due to end at 20 and he really wanted to get us settled before that time came. He called down to Ime and then volunteered to go down to the front desk to see what he could find. In a short time Pablo called and said that room 304 was available and had a balcony. He said he would show it to us so we could make sure it was what we wanted so we all met at room 304. The room was perfect and it had a nice large balcony overlooking the harbor and the pool. He brought our luggage to the room and got us all settled. Then I went down to the front desk to exchange keys. Now Lanika sp had joined Ime at the desk and had our room keys. She was very nice and asked if we were happy with the room. I assured her it was perfect. The rest of the weekend whenever we passed the front desk or the valet bellman area we were greeted and treated warmly. Upon departure on Sunday we were pleased to see that Ime Lanika and Pablo were all there. They all once again made sure that our stay was a good one which it was. Thanks so much for taking such good care of. See you soon. Rick Phylis Rits Turlock CA.
Excellent. Nicely located hotel right on jack london square. Quiet except for the occasional train nice view on the waterside. Windows can open.

Wonderful Staff and Great Hotel. All of the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful from the moment that we walked up to the front door of the hotel especially Keny Alie and the rooms service staff. The rooms are well decorated clean and comfortable. The view was gorgeous. The food was good and the in room dining staff made changes to my room service order to fit my very specific dietary restrictions. I was in town for work and for fun and my partner stayed here with me. My co workers and I stay here often when we come into town for meetings because it is well priced. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends and colleagues.

Great location and staff. I stay here when I have conferences to attend in Oakland. Walking distance to all the restaurants in the Jack London Square area. Clean rooms and you can open the windows for fresh air on the harbor side.

This was the best hotel i have ever stayed at. The service was amazing and there was nice appliances in the rooms and not to mention the amazing view of the bay. Also the location is amazing right next to Jack London Square with all of its amazing restaurants like The Forge. I look forward to coming back again when I am in the Bay Area.

Excellent Customer Service. For an older property the hotel is well kempt. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. We have stayed at The Waterfront a few times and have always enjoyed our stay. The front desk valet and housekeeping staff are attentive and made us feel welcome. The location could not be better. Walking distance to great bars restaurants and stores. I ate dinner in the bar and although the bartenders were very friendly and courteous I felt they were a little overwhelmed when it really was not that busy. Meaning I noticed people waiting for service including myself unnecessarily. Maybe I am just getting old but I do not think bartenders and wait staff should be allowed to have their cell phones while on duty. I was disappointed with my dinner. I had risotto with shrimp which was very bland. For the price I expected a little more. Overall I highly recommend staying here. I am looking forward to my next stay.

Waterfront Delight. I had an absolutely delightful stay at the Waterfront Hotel. My room was outstanding. The area is right in the middle of Jack London Square walking distance to everything. Wonderful view from my room and balcony of the marina. The room was very quiet and comfortable.

Outstanding Hotel. I am not exaggerating when I say that this hotel is superb the property the service housekeeping location beauty access to Ferry going to San Francisco you name it. it is perfect. Also room service is terrific and quick. We used room service three times and it was quick and delicious each time.

Do I open with Wire Fraud or do I open with lack of Professionalism with the cowardice of a 12 year old to go with it. I would be lying if i said things did not start out smoothly the certainly did. I had landed early in San Francisco around 115 in the morning and having to be somewhere for work I called the hotel to see if I could potentially check in Early. To my surprise a room was available for me I get to the hotel and check in for what was supposed to be a 12 day stay. Now I had called two or three weeks in advance and had spoken with someone from the hotel to book the reservation AND confirm what exactly the penalties for an early departure might be. I was informed that the penalty for an early checkout was One 1 additional nights stay. After the booking I called back again now 2 days away from my reservation and still before the breaking the hotels 48 hour window cancellation policy just to confirm that the reservation was still there and that the penalty was only One additional nights stay. I informed the hotel at that time that I was not sure if it was more beneficial for me to make one long reservation or if making a few short ones would be more better for me because I knew that I could potentially be checking out early. With my line of work I know very well that I may be called at any moment to leave the country. I am a Merchant Mariner that works for the United States Government regularly tasked with making sure that our Troops domestic and abroad have their equipment delivered on time and at the right destination. I was advised by hotel staff to keep the reservation for the long trip and that only a one nights stay would be my penalty for checking out early. Well on the following Monday Day 5 of my stay I was called to report to a ship that was overseas and that I would be leaving Monday night Tuesday Morning. I went to the front desk Checked out and was handed a printed receipt balance paid in full and was on my way. See Photos. A Day later After a little back and fourth Via text messaging I was informed that I would be charged for the entire length of my stay due to the Special Rate I had received. I responded that this did not seem accurate and they did not have the AUTHORIZATION to charge my card I did n’t hear back from the hotel at all about this they simply decided that it was unimportant to answer my response … mind you this was ALL via text messaging … very professional. To my surprise two days later after LOCKING my card down there is a pending charge for significant dollar amount more. I called the credit card company to dispute the charge. After speaking with the claims department the person asked if I would be willing to do a conference call with the hotel to see if we could possibly orchestrate a refund I agreed was put on hold and when the claims rep came back on the line after having tried to call the hotel She explained to me that she was bounced around and put on hold numerous times and when finally linked to someone in the accounting department they picked up and hung the phone up on her. We processed the dispute right then and there. To this day I have continuously been bombarded with text messages and emails from this establishment bordering on harassment after I have tried to opt out of these messaging services. I hope that although this write up was long it sheds some light on the way that the Waterfront hotel conducts its business. They believe in handling things via text message and when confronted feel it is ok to hang up on people. This indicates to me that it is n’t the first time they have done this. Maybe this is how they feel members of our military and those that help them should be treated. None the less it was all childish and could have been avoided ultimately changing my whole perspective on the place. Such a disgrace to the hospitality industry.

Do n’t stay here bc they wo nt give you room you booked has mosquitoes and is really loud ceiling from. Paid for 2 queen beds but they gave away my room so my tall son had to sleep on dilapidated roll away sofa there was live mosquito in room the upstairs floor creaked and could hear evro. Paid for 2 queen beds but they gave away my room so my tall son had to sleep on dilapidated roll away sofa there was live mosquito in room the upstairs floor creaked and could hear everything.

Go Giants. Great location to catch ferry to Giants game. Front desk service was great. Impressed that patio which had double doors to help make train noise minimal which many reviews complained about.

Great Location. The location is amazing. The room was big and the balcony was awesome. Great view. Our only complaint was the room was n’t ready until 430pm and the front guest did n’t apologize for the inconvenience or offer us anything to make our wait more comfortable.
Other than that it was pretty good. There was one issue. Apparently the cleaning crew did not clean the balcony the previous visitor left drug paraphernalia pretty much in plain view.

I stayed in a 1King bed suite with a sea view from August 9 12 2019. It was something I wanted to visit for many years had to wait till I retired. The Waterfront Hotel is a seafaring themed hotel hesitate to say nautical themed. Each room or suite is quite large as large as a medium sized studio. I opted for the sea view which encompasses not only Jack London Square it ’s located in the middle of it just a few feet from the sculpture of the famous author but the ocean Alameda distant San Francisco. On Friday early evening to the weekends the sea view allows you to take in the three day festivities festooned with tents shops street food American Creole Soul dancers music the energy of people. The rooms are equipped with the standard fare but there is a nice dorm room sized refrigerator hidden in the cabinet beneath the large screen TV37 ” or larger. Next to it is your safe large enough for laptops other items. Below the safe is a 4dreser drawer ensemble. Two bottles of Kala Springs water is delivered daily. The bed is comfortable but I lounged watching TV on the large sofa as well. A circular dining table is positioned by the windows which can be opened enough to lean out taking in the nice sea breeze the aromas of a pizzeria just across the walkway the foods being prepared enjoyed outdoors from the hotel ’s Lungomare Restaurant Tuscan style Scott ’s Seafood Kincaid ’s Fish Chophouse restaurants the latter two walking distance. The room ’s bathroom is unique the bathtub shower is molded one piece with shelves a sturdy bar to hold onto. That part is built like the bunks from the seafaring days of the 170 180s. The shower head is adjustable from pinpoint to spray to both. There is a large desk with a curved back chair straddling four magazines introducing the guest to the sights sounds cuisines culture of Oakland. In room dining is from the Lungomare Restaurant a Tuscan cuisine of whose culinary dishes are lovingly handmade. I had a wonderful hand tossed pizza all pizzas are medium14 ”. accompanied by a prosciutto plate. If you ’re lucky to be in the east or Spinnaker Tower your elevators 2 drops you into a corridor leading to the restaurant. Note that the restaurant is packed reservations are recommended. Sunday Brunch encompasses the usual culinary fare. I had a Bolognese pasta with veal pork beef accompanied by nicely marinated vegetables. Dessert is either a Budino gelato or sorbet. There ’s an extensive wine list a selection of beers. The staff is knowledgeable especially for allergies they try to accommodate everyone. I gave it 4stars only because 15blocks away a rail line shared by Amtrak Caltrain freight shares rumbles around. This is a must visit hotel where the professional knowledgeable staff will accommodate you. It ’s part of the Joie de Vivre chain which is now part of the Hyat portfolio group of hotels.
Had to book two rooms did not arrive until midnight had a hard time getting the late check out needed. The carpet in the room was dirty. It was way too expensive for a 3 star hotel.

Online pictures look great unfortunetly they do not tell the whole story. The room itself was old paper thin walls and cheap updates to give a trendy look. We were in a building not connected the lobby and had to walk quite a ways outside to reach the entrance. There were fees we were not made aware of when booking. A 15 a day resort fe for what I am not sure. Pool was outdoors and notusable the time of year we stayed. Housekeeping never came to refresh our room the first night. We ran out of toilet paper and called the front deck to have some sent along with coffee. Neither ever came and we had to roam the halls looking for a housekeeper so we could use the bathroom after waiting over an hour. Housekeeper said only the front desk had coffee packets and she did not know why they didint tell me that when I called. When we went to the front desk to make sure our room was refreshed the second day the girl at the counter was rude unhelpful and cut me off to tell me it would be done. We expected more in terms of customer service when taking the time to communicate an issue. The second night a party boat debarked out side our room at 2 am and drunk people were yelling and carrying on for over an hour. When I called the front desk they said it was not on the property so there was nothing they could do. The third night someone checked into the room above us and we realized how thin the walls really are. We could hear their tv and walking aorund all night.

Very Good. Breakfast was good location was really good. Layout of the hotel was a bit strange and learning entrances and exits took a bit of time. The room was quite large. A view of the water would have been great. The floors are very thin and we could hear people in the upstairs unit whenever they walked. We expected higher quality construction and sound proofing for the price of the room.
Room was cold and did not respond to request to fixSurprise amenity fee on departureEnjoyed wine and cheese.
